ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Facial nerve hemangioma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Confirmed by exploratory surgery; presented with mixed hearing loss, facial twitching, and absent reflexes.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Facial nerve schwannoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial imaging differential diagnosis consistent with facial nerve symptoms and audiologic findings.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine type, degree, and configuration of hearing loss given subjective changes.
To assess speech understanding and agreement with pure-tone thresholds.
To evaluate middle ear status and eardrum mobility.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc, particularly given facial twitching symptoms.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a left mixed hearing loss and normal hearing on the right. Despite the conductive component (air-bone gaps) on the left, tympanometry is normal (Type A) bilaterally. Acoustic reflexes are absent when the probe is in the left ear (ipsilateral left and contralateral right) but present when the probe is in the right ear (ipsilateral right and contralateral left). This 'vertical' pattern of reflex abnormalities, combined with facial twitching, suggests pathology affecting the efferent pathway (facial nerve) or middle ear mechanics on the left side, rather than a cochlear or afferent issue.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal thresholds sloping to slight SNHL at 4 kHz, and rising to within normal limits from 6,000 to 8,000 Hz. Left ear slight to mild mixed loss (250-2000 Hz) sloping to moderate/moderately-severe mixed loss in high frequencies, and rising to moderate at 8,000 Hz; air-bone gaps present.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Excellent word recognition scores bilaterally (96%). SRTs agree with PTAs.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right Ipsi present. Left Ipsi absent. Right Contra (Probe Left) absent/elevated. Left Contra (Probe Right) present at 1-2 kHz. Pattern suggests left efferent (facial nerve) pathology.

tests.name: Acoustic reflex decay
tests.result_summary: Could not be measured at 500 and 1000 Hz due to absent contralateral acoustic reflex thresholds.

proposed_items: Hearing aid evaluation for the left ear (pending medical clearance)
Use of hearing protection in noise
counseling_actions: Explain the mixed nature of the hearing loss and the discrepancy between normal tympanograms and absent reflexes.
Discuss the correlation between the audiologic findings and the reported facial twitching.
Advise on the necessity of medical referral for imaging to investigate the facial nerve.

red_flags_present: Absent acoustic reflexes with normal tympanometry

escalation.rationale_short: Signs of facial nerve pathology (twitching, absent reflexes) and unilateral mixed loss require MRI/CT to rule out retrocochlear mass.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds and functional status post-intervention.

expected_outcome: MRI and CT scans: Revealed either a left facial nerve schwannoma or a hemangioma.
Exploratory surgery: Confirmed a left hemangioma, which was mostly removed.
Post-surgical status: Hearing decreased slightly after surgery, and facial twitching slightly improved.
